intro: Lunathyrium sichuanense var. jinfoshanense, commonly known as the Jinfoshan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with moist, well-drained soils. It has lanceolate to ovate leaves and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
